Package org.springframework.web.reactive.accept

@NullMarked package org.springframework.web.reactive.accept
RequestedContentTypeResolver strategy and implementations to resolve the requested content type for a given request.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.springframework.web.reactive
    Top-level package for the spring-webflux module that contains DispatcherHandler, the main entry point for WebFlux server endpoint processing including key contracts used to map requests to handlers, invoke them, and process the result.
  • Class
    Description
    ApiVersionDeprecationHandler
    Contract to add handling of requests with a deprecated API version.
    ApiVersionResolver
    Contract to extract the version from a request.
    ApiVersionStrategy
    The main component that encapsulates configuration preferences and strategies to manage API versioning for an application.
    DefaultApiVersionStrategy
    Default implementation of ApiVersionStrategy that delegates to the configured version resolvers, version parser, and deprecation handler.
    FixedContentTypeResolver
    Resolver that always resolves to a fixed list of media types.
    HeaderApiVersionResolver
    ApiVersionResolver that extracts the version from a request header.
    HeaderContentTypeResolver
    Resolver that looks at the 'Accept' header of the request.
    MediaTypeParamApiVersionResolver
    ApiVersionResolver that extracts the version from a media type parameter found in the Accept or Content-Type headers.
    ParameterContentTypeResolver
    Resolver that checks a query parameter and uses it to look up a matching MediaType.
    PathApiVersionResolver
    ApiVersionResolver that extract the version from a path segment.
    QueryApiVersionResolver
    ApiVersionResolver that extracts the version from a query parameter.
    RequestedContentTypeResolver
    Strategy to resolve the requested media types for a ServerWebExchange.
    RequestedContentTypeResolverBuilder
    Builder for a composite RequestedContentTypeResolver that delegates to other resolvers each implementing a different strategy to determine the requested content type -- for example, Accept header, query parameter, or other.
    RequestedContentTypeResolverBuilder.ParameterResolverConfigurer
    Helper to create and configure ParameterContentTypeResolver.
    StandardApiVersionDeprecationHandler
    ApiVersionDeprecationHandler based on RFC 9745 and RFC 8594 that provides the option to set the "Deprecation" and "Sunset" response headers, as well as to add "Link" headers with further details about both.
